news_header: Austrian police issued an arrest warrant for a woman posing as a shaman to defraud victims of over 10 million euros.
news_original_title: Austrian police search for 'shaman fraudster' suspect
news_text: Police in Austria have issued a European arrest warrant for a woman named Mariana M, who allegedly posed as a shaman to defraud victims out of large sums of money. They discovered cash, jewellery, and gold worth over 10 million euros at her home. Mariana M, a 44-year-old Austrian citizen, is believed to have defrauded individuals in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland. One victim was told she needed to pay 730,000 euros for 'cleansing rituals' to break a curse. After receiving the money, the suspect cut off contact. Police urge other victims to come forward.
